alert.note: Alert for Frontier (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 3:03PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WESTERN FRONTIER AND SOUTHEASTERN LINCOLN COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM CDT... At 303 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southwest of Stockville, or 15 miles south of Curtis, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Curtis, Moorefield, Stockville, Maywood, Quick, Hansen Memorial Reserve State Wildlife Management Area, Bluegill Haven Campground, Willow View Campground, Red Willow Reservoir State Recreation Area, and Dancing Leaf Earth Lodge. This includes Highway 83 between mile markers 27 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southwestern Nebraska.
